concept.title: Configuring the server locale, date and time
concept.shortdesc: You can configure the server locale, date and time either by using the , or by using the command line.

conbody.p: You can configure the server locale and timezone by using the , or by using the locale set and timezone set commands on the command line. The server locale details are used for the translation and formatting of messages. If a translation for a specified language is not available, US English is used.

You can configure the server date and time manually by using the or by using the datetime set command on the command line. You can configure the date and time automatically by using network time protocol (NTP) servers to synchronize the server time with another server. You can configure NTP servers by using the , or by using the set-ntp-servers command on the command line.

Using NTP servers to synchronize the time ensures that the time is automatically updated, and is therefore always correct. It is important for the time to be correct as it is used in key information such as log files and monitoring data.

note.p: The server locale and timezone, server date and time, and NTP server settings are configured per-appliance and are not replicated between HA pairs.
